I've been working very long on Alfresco as a Developer. Started with version 2.2. and am still going hard with the latest version.

The first 3 years with Alfresco I was working for a company, then I started my own firm. After my own firm I realized how important the community is. So then I started contributing as in Jira fixes, blogs and after a while on StackOverflow.

After the first Dashlet competition I started writing addons and pieces of code for Alfresco & the community. Now a days I'm developing a lot of stuff, mainly custom modules and I try to blog once in a while.

• Addons: Alfresco Advanced Folder Search, Alfresco AND Search, YouTube Dashlet, Move2Folder
    • Blogs: http://www.contezza.nl/blog, http://blog.mitco-solutions.com/

name: Morgan
summary:
A young French guy of 24 years old. Morgan got an engineering degree in computer science a little bit less than 2 years ago. He was born and still live in France but he works in Switzerland.

Morgan discovered Alfresco almost 4 years ago and that day, he decided to become a "Middleware Man". Morgan is working in the Middleware Team of "dbi services", a Swiss IT Consulting company. Within this team, guys mainly work with several application servers (WebLogic, JBoss, Tomcat, Apache, OHS, aso...), several DMS (Documentum, SharePoint, Alfresco) and some other open source technologies like Kerberos. Morgan joined this enterprise a little bit more than 2 years ago since his "end of studies internship" consisted in the analysis and comparison of several Document Management Systems for dbi services - of course, Alfresco was chosen ;). Since that day, he installed, configured and administered Alfresco (Community or Enterprise editions) for customers and company internal use.
contributions:
• Morgan likes to use his company's website to post some blogs entries related to Open Sources technologies including Alfresco.
  • Morgan also has an account on the Alfresco forum. He tries to spend at least 1h per week to read the Alfresco Forum for new posts, maybe to find something to add aso...

I've always been an advocate of open source software and really liked the vibe of Alfresco in the early days. name: David
summary:
I've been working on Share and the APIs it uses for 4.5 years, after joining Alfresco's engineering team. I've touched most areas of Share, its APIs, but calendar, date/time and localisation and hybrid sync issues keep finding their way to my desk. I come from a web development background, so love the fact that client side technologies just won't stand still.

Recently I've been working on moving existing Share functionality to Aikau, the 5.0 search improvements as well as background tasks like development environment improvements, bringing in Grunt, simplifying maven usage and the way we run UI unit tests.
contributions:
• I blog at http://blogs.alfresco.com/wp/dwebster/.

name: Jan
summary: Alfresco Core Developer - primarily working on the Alfresco Platform (Core Repository, Services and APIs).
contributions: Author of many technical Alfresco presentations and speaker on the most of DevCon, Summit and BeeCon conferences.

name: Allan
summary:
I am ECM consultant and my last experience was urlsing Alfresco, which was completely new to me at that time.

I am trying to get much more confident with Alfresco and I would like to learn from this community in order to become a developer and to contribute to make Alfresco a popular ECM solution in Brazil.

name: Omar
summary:
I'm an Alfresco consultant and developer working for the French Alfresco partner StarXpert.

I'm also an Alfresco Certified Engineer 5.
contributions: I answer topics in the Alfresco Community: principally in the French User Group.

name: Mauricio
summary: Activiti Cloud OSS (activiti.org) Tech Leader working at Alfresco. Previously Mauricio worked for Red Hat / JBoss in the Drools & jBPM projects, where he author 4 books about these projects. With more than 10 years of experience in Java and in the Business Automation field Mauricio is pushing forward to modernise a very conservative industry by following the Open Source Way.

name: Ryan
summary: Software Engineer on the core Activiti team.
contributions: Development work on Activiti, active on the community portal and presenting at events (e.g. Activiti Cloud Deep Dive).

name: Elias
summary: I'm a clean coding and unit testing enthusiast. I have 7+ years of experience in Java and Process Engine related technologies.
contributions: One of the Activiti Core Developers

name: Katerina
summary: I am an alfresco developer working for a company (atenekom) currently using the alfresco community edition in order to provide document management solutions to numerous public partners in Germany.

name: Krutik
summary: My self Krutik Jayswal. I am alfresco certified engineer.I would like to be an architect in alfresco. The best achievement in my life till now is solving the rubik's cube, other than that I like to develop addons in alfresco in my spare time.I like to do travelling as well. Recently i attended devcon and it was the another best experience to meet all the people of community and alfresco.
contributions:
• Addon for exporting in excel
  • Contributions in Community
  • Contribution in stackoverflow

name: Dan
summary: Content Management enthusiast with past experience in eRoom, Documentum, Sharepoint and FileNet, now focusing on Alfresco. Very happy with the modular and distributable approach of Alfresco and its components. I am also very happy with the enthusiastic Alfresco community, and would like to give back the ecosystem.
contributions:
• participant in the Alfresco Community Forums
  • actively promoting Alfresco (Community and Enterprise) to our current Sharepoint and Documentum customers

name: Douglas
summary:
I am a serial Doctorpreneur, radiologist and Clinical Informatist, healthcare software developer and CHCIO.

We have an innovation company supporting a radiology and legal information management use case . We have a Mulesoft ESB centric Ecosystem completed connected by internal APIs and building Enterprise FHIR compliance or "The FHIR Within Healthcare". We would like to leverage Alfresco content store with FHIR supportiung data governance controls via metadata controls at a separate logical layer.

I was referred by members of the HealthCare Enterprise team.

name: Jayesh
summary:
Specialties In Enterprise Content Management, Portal and Integration

PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY:

  • 10+ years of experience in IT industry.
  • Co-Author of Alfresco enterprise content management guide book.
  • Proficient in ECM and Portal technologies like Alfresco & Liferay.
  • Alfresco recognized developer.
  • Have been Alfresco certified trainer for document management.
  • Executed project successfully with various role like Sr. Developer, team lead, tech lead, Alfresco architect.
  • Experienced in design and develop solution for client using Liferay, Alfresco and other ecosystem.
  • Proficient programming skills using Java, JSP, Servlets, web scripts, Design Patterns, Object Oriented Methodologies.
  • Expertise in Object Oriented Analysis & Design Principles and various J2EE Design Patterns.
  • Experience with using IDEs like Eclipse 3.x, Version Control Systems like Subversion.
  • Hands on experience on ANT and Maven.
  • Experience in application deployment and performance tuning.
  • Extensive experience with Operating systems like UNIX, Linux, Windows.
  • Experienced with installation, configuration and tuning of Liferay, Alfresco on Windows and Unix platforms.
  • Experienced in all phases of software life cycle like analysis, designing, developing, testing, installing, configuring and maintaining applications.
  • Excellent hands-on experience dealing with the onsite – offshore model.
  • Effective result oriented team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
contributions:
• Alfresco forum: https://community.alfresco.com/people/jayesh.prajapati2010
  • Book on Alfresco: https://www.packtpub.com/books/info/authors/jayesh-prajapati
  • I usually write blogs on my company site and encourage my Colleague

name: Gerrit
summary: I am an Alfresco Developer and Administrator, working with Alfresco since 2006. I have been involved in multiple Alfresco projects and our company has a very large focus in South-Africa in providing solutions and support for Alfresco.
contributions: Held various meetups and conferences since 2006.

name: Rupesh
summary: I have been working on Alfresco since year 2007 and currently associated with EnProwess Technologies Pvt. Ltd. as a Practice head.
contributions: I have been active on forums to help the community, I have participated in hackathon with my team here.

name: Prasobhraj
summary: I am IT Engineer, interested in developing software, open source applications. Now in python domain.
contributions: I was using alfresco for many years. More experienced in implementing and deploying alfresco activiti workflows. My profile on Alfresco Community - prasobhraj.

name: Michael
